item.title: ‘I’m on Fire’: Testosterone Is Giving Women Back Their Sex Drive — and Then Some
item.description: There is no F.D.A.-approved testosterone product for women. Insurance won’t cover it. Many doctors won’t prescribe it. It’s become a cultural phenomenon.

item.title: The Villains on Pre-K TV Are Cuddly, Annoying and … Morally Interesting
item.description: Streaming services have brought a glut of animated shows targeted at small children — and an interesting approach to depicting conflict.

item.title: The Dessert That Changed My Life
item.description: These unforgettable poached pears set a food writer on her trajectory.

item.title: Takeaways From the Times Magazine Story on Testosterone and Sex Drive
item.description: Here’s when and why experts think testosterone should be prescribed to middle-aged women, and how it affects their lives.

item.title: My Spouse’s Politics Are Bewildering. Do I Have to Warn Our Houseguest?
item.description: I want my guest to be comfortable, and I want to avoid discomfort, too.

item.title: Stavros Halkias Wants a Career. Will His Fans Let Him Have One?
item.description: The comedian is pivoting from online notoriety to mainstream roles. It’s harder than it looks.

item.title: Anthony Hopkins on Quitting Drinking and Finding God
item.description: The actor, now 87, talks about his childhood, the epiphanies in his life and more.

item.title: My Best Friend’s Affair Is Eating at Me. Should I Tell?
item.description: I hoped it would end. It hasn’t.

item.title: I Co-Parent My Kids. Would It Be Wrong to Move Abroad?
item.description: How should I weigh my children’s emotional needs against my own need for healing, belonging and growth?

item.title: Can Anyone Rescue the Trafficked Girls of L.A.’s Figueroa Street?
item.description: Inside the effort to pull minors from ‘the Blade,’ one of the most notorious sex-trafficking corridors in the United States.

item.title: The Island That Keeps the Earth’s Secrets
item.description: Sulawesi, Indonesia, blurs the boundaries between myth and ecology. What might it reveal about our past – or destiny?

item.title: A Teen in Love With a Chatbot Killed Himself. Can the Chatbot Be Held Responsible?
item.description: A mother in Florida filed a lawsuit against an A.I. start-up, alleging its product led to her son’s death. The company’s defense raises a thorny legal question.

item.title: In the Trump Presidency, the Rules Are Vague. That Might Be the Point.
item.description: The U.S. has long believed that unspecific laws threaten democracy. So why is the administration being so vague?
